Package mvc.model

Interface BetterStockManager

  • All Superinterfaces:
    StockManager
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AdvancedStockManager
    public interface BetterStockManager
extends StockManager
    The BetterStockManager interface extends the original model interface and adds additional functionality to adjust a portfolio on a specific day.

    • Method Detail

      • adjustPortfolioOnDay

        void adjustPortfolioOnDay​(java.lang.String name,
                          java.lang.String ticker,
                          double shares,
                          java.time.LocalDate date)
        The adjustPortfolioOnDay method supports the addition and subtraction of shares of a stock from a single portfolio on a specific day. If a stock is already found in a portfolio, that stock will be updated. Otherwise, a new stock with a given number of shares will be added to the portfolio. If the number of shares of a certain stock reaches 0, that stock will be removed from the portfolio. No stock may have negative shares.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the portfolio
        ticker - the stock ticker
        shares - the number of shares to be added
        date - the date to complete the transaction

      • getComposition

        java.lang.String getComposition​(java.lang.String name,
                                java.time.LocalDate date)
        The getComposition method return the composition of a portfolio on a given day.
        Parameters:
        name - the portfolio to search
        date - the given date
        Returns:
        a string list of composition

      • portfolioDistribution

        java.lang.String portfolioDistribution​(java.lang.String name,
                                       java.time.LocalDate date)
        The portfolioDistribution method returns, as a string a description of the distribution of value in a portfolio including the stocks, their corresponding values, and percentages on a given date.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the portfolio to analyze
        date - the date to lookup
        Returns:
        the distribution string

      • portfolioRebalance

        void portfolioRebalance​(java.lang.String name,
                        java.time.LocalDate date,
                        double[] distributions)
        The portfolio rebalance method rebalances the given portfolio with the desired distributions. Rebalance will never result in negative shares even if shares are subtracted in the future, for example if one buys 5 shares of GOOG on 2024-5-1 and 5 shares of PFE on 2024-5-2, then sells 4.9 shares of GOOG on 2024-6-1, if the user tries to rebalance on 2024-5-3 with a 50 - 50 distribution, the user will get an error message saying that negative shares are not allowed because rebalancing does not invalidate future transactions. Also, if there is only one stock in a portfolio on the rebalance date, the program will still prompt the user for weights but regardless of the weight the stock will not be changed and there is no need for rebalancing.
        Parameters:
        name - portoflio to rebalance
        date - the date on which to rebalance
        distributions - the desired weights

      • plotPortfolio

        java.lang.String plotPortfolio​(java.lang.String name,
                               DateRange range)
        The plot method returns a visual representation of a portfolio's performance over a time range of WEEK, MONTH, YEAR, FIVE_YEARS, or TEN_YEARS.
        Parameters:
        range - the DateRange enum object range

      • savePortfolio

        void savePortfolio​(java.lang.String name)
        The savePortfolio method searches this list of portfolios and saves the corresponding portfolio with the given name to a directory call portfolios. The saves portfolio is a CSV data file name 'portfolio-name'.csv.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the portfolio to save

      • loadPortfolio

        void loadPortfolio​(java.lang.String name)
        The loadPortfolio method loads a portfolio file that is a CSV file, is formatted correctly, and is in the 'portfolios' directory. One will be automatically created the first time you save a portfolio but if you are starting by loading one in, you must create your own and it must be named "portfolios". The loaded portfolio is added to the models list of portfolios and supports all operations.
        Parameters:
        name - name of portfolio to search
